Ms Allen made the bombshell comments at a press briefing in Parliament tonight after becoming the th MP to join the group, along with Tory Remainers Anna Soubry and Sarah Wollaston. Askedshe wouldto her old party she replied: I cant imagine it. I just cant. Not least becausewe do our jobs right, there wont be a Tory party to go back to.   Were about creating something better that is bang smack in the centre ground of British politics that people out there, I am convinced, we are convinced, want. This is about the future. This is not about going back. She blasted Downing Street for an absolutely staggering failure to reach out before she quit. She said: The Prime Minister must know she has a very small - purchased - majority. So we should be important. She claimed colleagues had waved and winked and blown kisses and messaged her saying bleakly: Dont leave me. Dont leave me with them. But of Tory HQ she blasted: This is physical evidence of how dysal the party has become.   That were not protected from the bottom up in terms of entryism or yellow jackets yelling at us on the street. And were not protected from the top down. The organisation is dysal, its not a team any more. It doesnt wrap itself around us. The comments came in a y press conference by Ms Allen and ex-Labour MP Chris Leslie. During the QA, Ms Allen openly admitted we are not ready to face a string of by-elections because they would crush us. And Mr Leslie indicated the Independent Group would NOT back Labour in a vote of no confidence against the government. He said: We dont believe right now, at this moment of national crisis, a general election would be right for the country. The MPs admitted theyre going to have their rows after Anna Soubry heaped praise on cruel Tory austerity.   If youre searching for disagreements you will be able to find them, Chris Leslie told the group of journalists. Heidi Allen added MPs would not be sent to abrainwashing conference to make sure they agree. But they said more could join, with Ms Allen saying: There are sympathetic ministers at all levels. AskedTory Phillip Lee will join the group, Heidi Allen replied: What about Justine [Greening]  What about everybody  Ms Allen said the Three Amigos of the Tories did not know the seven Labour MPs were quitting on Monday before they did.Afterwards we then thought right, okay, when  she said. Meanwhile Mr Leslie blasted the big parties as acarteland said the Labour Party sadly look as though they are taking a very negative approach to whats happening. Even though the group is pro-EU, Mr Leslie suggested it may accept MPs who dont support a second referendum. And he tried to dismiss claims he could work with the Lib Dems. Were not joining the Lib Dems. We believe there are problems with all the parties... They have got a clear trust issue, he said. He also claimed the group had earned thousands of small money backers already and would declare its funding in due course. Despite being backed by an opaque private company, he said, Obviously the Electoral Commission have rules for political parties. While were not a political party yet weve set out to say we will map over the rules on parties as though we were a political party and comply with the full disclosures of that.

title: independent group anna soubry defends
story: NewsIndependent Group: Anna Soubry DEFENDS cruel Tory cuts just minutes after quittingAnna Soubry clashed with her new Independent Group colleague Heidi Allen by claiming the government had done a "marvellous job"ShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video soubry-defends-tory-cuts-despite-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAn MP has DEFENDED devastating Tory austerity just minutes after she quit the party supposedly to make a fresh start. Anna Soubry claimed billions in cruel welfare cuts were absolutely necessary and the government had done a marvellous job. The former Business Minister made her shock comments in a press conference where she was one of the Tory Three Amigos quitting for the new Independent Group. The group now has  members including  from Labour - yet Ms Soubrys comments show they are already split on massive issues. Speaking minutes earlier, ex-Tory Heidi Allen said Tory policies had deepened the suffering endured by the most vulnerable in society and she could no longer represent them. But askedshe regretted welfare changes and austerity, Ms Soubry said: I believe we did the right thing in the Coalition government in particular.   I think the Coalition government which I served in did a marvellous job. She said David Cameron “made many mistakes” - and acknowledged some councils were now struggling as a result of cuts. But she added: I have to say I think the things we did to the economy were absolutely necessary at the time.  I don’t have a problem with that. A Labour source said: It didnt take long for the Independent Group to show their hand and reveal they stand for privatisation, austerity and tax cuts for the rich. It came as Theresa May was hit with a bombshell Tory split as three of her most high-profile anti-Brexit MPs quit the party.   Heidi Allen, Sarah Wollaston and Anna Soubry dramatically crossed the floor of the House of Commons today and sat on the opposition benches as they joined the Independent Group. In a devastating joint resignation letter to Theresa May , the trio said she is now in the grip of hard Brexit Tories and the final straw has been this governments disastrous handling of Brexit. And in a savage press conference, Ms Allen said Mrs May had been bullied into submission by hard Brexiteers dragging the country kicking and screaming into the abyss.  She added bluntly: Im done. And Ms Soubry said: I’m not leaving the Conservative Party - it’s left us. Heidi Allen joked: You’ve met the Magnicent Seven, you’ve probably heard last night about the lone ranger, so I guess that makes us the three amigos. It is a crushing blow to the Prime Minister just moments before Prime Ministers Questions - and hours before she s to Brussels in a bid to get a deal  days before we leave. Mrs May responded by saying she was saddened and thanking the MPs for their service. Speaking after Ms Soubrys comments, fellow Independent Group MP Chris Leslie admitted: Being the Independent Group we are definitely going to continue to have independent free thinking iniduals who will not always agree on every issue. If youre searching for disagreements you will be able to find them, but I actually think that is the reality of mainstream Britain. Heidi Allen said MPs would not be sent to abrainwashing conference to make sure they agree. Chris Leslie insisted that unlike claims by Labour I am anti-austerity and I am not in favour of privatisation.

title: independent group heidi allens full
story: NewsIndependent Group: Heidi Allens full speech savaging Tories for causing sufferingThe South Cambridgeshire MP was one of three Tories to leave her party over Brexit - and said Theresa May has deepened the "suffering endured by the most vulnerable in society"ShareCommentsByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video watch-heidi-allens-speech-full-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailEx-Tory MP Heidi Allen savaged cruel welfare policies in a speech announcing shed quit the party.Ms Allen is one of three Tories to have joined the new Independent Group sitting on the opposition benches in Parliament.Alongside Dr Sarah Wollaston and Anna Soubry, she spoke of her disappointment at the direction the Conservative Party had taken. In a savage press conference, Ms Allen said Mrs May had been bullied into submission by hard Brexiteers dragging the country kicking and screaming into the abyss. She added bluntly: Im done. Ms Allen said she had no political interest until the  riots, when watching the news night after night it was asLord Kitchener was pointing his finger out of the screen to me. ‘Your country needs you’. She thought David Cameron was the answer, she said, but found myself going over the top fighting for benevolence in our welfare system. Slamming Tory MPs who sit idly by nodding through policy and voting like sheep, she said: I am tired of feeling numb. She added: I feel excited. So excited in a way I havent felt since I was first elected - and a sense of liberation. Yet she refused calls to resign and test her new mandate in a by-election - saying the big parties could use it as a chance to crush the birth of democracy.   Heidi Allens speech in full: So nice so many friends in the room. So youve met the magnicent seven, you probably heard last night about the lone ranger, so I guess that makes us the Three Amigos. My name is Heidi Allen and Im very very proud to be the Member for Parliament for South Cambridgeshire. I love my constituency, it is bursting with innovation and a desire to challenge the status quo. I love that my constituents want to share their talents and their discoveries to make the world a better place and to tackle inequalities. My constituents make my head and my heard fizz with possibilities. I want to feel that way in Westminster too. I am tired of feeling numb. . So today, alongside my wonderful colleagues, I have resigned from the Conservative Party. It was the Tottenham riots in  that stimulated my change in career. I was busy running my own manufacturing business, I had no political interest whatsoever and Id never even thought about joining a political party. But watching the news night after night it was asLord Kitchener was pointing his finger out of the screen at me: Your Country Needs You! That raw hunger to serve my country and to offer my skills and experience led me to the Conservative Party. I believe that under David Cameron and his Big Society the party, like me, was ambitious for the country.   It was challenging the Nasty Party image and proving that we could, in fact, be a party of both competence and compassion. So why so often, too often, in the last three years have I found myself going over the top fighting for benevolence in our welfare system. The Department for Work and Pensions has had six secretaries of state in three years - six. You wouldnt run a business like that and expect it to succeed so how can it possibly be acceptable when you are completely redesigning our welfare safety net, particularly when that net is so vital when we are at our lowest and when we need it most because those that rely on the net are people and not numbers. I shouldnt have to feel that the only option left open to me is to take a camera crew around the country to shine a devastating spotlight on poverty. It shouldnt be this hard. I believed I was part of a party who worked collaboratively, welcomed knowledge and had the empathy to feel. But I have slowly but surely realised that I am not. I can no longer represent a government and a party who cant open their eyes to the suffering endured by the most vulnerable in society. Suffering which we have deepened whilst having the power to fix. The Conservatives were always recognised as the party of economic competence but when we allowed a cabinet minister to say eff business and we have a Prime Minister bullied into submission by the ERG and is now dragging the country and parliament kicking and screaming to the edge of a no deal abyss. Im done. I want to be part of something better.  A party th at people vote for because they want to - not because they feel they have to. But this afternoon I feel a mix of emotions: apprehension, some sadness, I do worry about my relationship with good friends Ive made with the Conservative Party they know who they are. But do you know what I also feel ladies and gentleman, I feel excited, so excited - and in a way that I havent felt since I was first elected, a sense of liberation, because the United Kingdom deserves better. I didnt leave my business to lower my professional standards and accept second best. I demand more for my party and more for my country, competence, more collaboration, more expert analysis, more transparency, more care and more fairness. It needs to push, and shove, and drive - not cower from its own shadow.   It should attract the best minds, the biggest hearts and the most effective communicators. I, we, are prepared to dare to dream that this could be possible. But its not going to happenwe sit idly by nodding through policy and voting like sheep.If Brexit was a pained clarion call for change, then we hear it.Our parties have been able to grasp the magnitude of the challenge and have no plan to respond, nor heal the isions across our cities, our villages, and our dining tables. So we need to start again with a clean sheet. And as true centre ground MPs sharing the same values as millions of our citizens. We have a responsibility to act.This week is the beginning. Once there were seven and now there are seven - and at the last count around , Twitter followers.So yes we are putting our heads above the parapet and we might fail. But isnt the prize worth fighting for. And I sense the country wants us to fight for it too. And I for one am prepared to give it everything Ive got.

title: independent group mps signal wont
story: NewsIndependent Group MPs signal they WONT unseat the Tories in no confidence voteLeading MP Chris Leslie claimed forcing an election was a "silly game" and not the "priority" - while Heidi Allen admitted holding one at this stage would "crush us"ShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  FEB NewsTheresa May will be relieved "Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Independent Group will refuse to help unseat the Tories in a no confidence vote, a leading MP has signalled.Chris Leslie said a general election would not be right for the country despite the group supposedly opposing Theresa Mays Brexit . It suggests Jeremy Corbyn will not be able to rely on the  MPs, including  ex-Tories, to help unseat the governmenthe forces another no confidence vote. If enough Tories came on board, it is possible the group could team up with other opposition parties and force Theresa May from office.But today Heidi Allen, one of three MPs who quit the Tories for the group, admitted the new group are not ready to face an election and it would crush us.  And askedthe new group would back a no confidence vote Mr Leslie said: We dont believe right now, at this moment of national crisis, a general election would be the right thing for the country. Next week weve got probably the most important set of Brexit votes. He said February  could turn into an all-night sitting of the Commons on whether to delay Brexit, and from our point of view, that has to be the priority. Mr Leslie even predicted Jeremy Corbyn might push for a repeat of the no confidence vote he tried - and failed - to pass in January. He told journalists: Clearly you can imagine circumstances, because its changing the numbers in terms of the government, that there might be some game playing by Jeremy Corbyn in terms of no confidence motions and all those things. Were quite alive to the fact that the Labour leadership are very much in the game playing mode. And I am in my own point of view not up for playing silly games any longer.   He added: Therefore I am certainly not pre-disposed to having an election at this time. Heidi Allen, who quit the Tories to join the group, added: Its not all about us. Its about what is best for the country. And a general election election would be THE worst thing, now at minus  hours or something until Brexit. That would be the last thing we need. She added: Given whats happened in both parties this week, I think both parties would be utterly foolish to try and push the nuclear button in a general election. I dont think theyll be looking for it either. It came despite Ms Allen telling journalists she wanted the new movement to destroy the Tory party. Askedshe wouldto her old party she replied: I cant imagine it. I just cant. Not least becausewe do our jobs right, there wont be a Tory party to go back to.

title: labour puts data lockdown after
story: NewsLabour puts data on lockdown after Independent Group MP accesses party informationEXCLUSIVE: Staff were locked out from accessing data as a furious warning was issued to MPs by general secretary Jennie FormbyShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political EditorOliver Milne:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsA Labour source confirmed data was accessed by one of the MPs in the Independent Group "Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailLabour put its data on lockdown today after accusing one of the eight MPs who quit of accessing party information. Staff were locked out from accessing data as a furious warning was issued to MPs by general secretary Jennie Formby. A Labour source confirmed data was accessed by one of the MPs in the Independent Group, though did not say who. The Independent Group did not immediatelya request for comment. The incident gives a flavour of the furious factional battles that can be expectedTIG candidates stand against Labour. Ms Formby sent a message to the Parliamentary Labour Party threatening action by the Information Commissioner watchdog. In the message sent to the Mirror she wrote: The Party’s elected representatives, at all levels, have a proud record of conscientiously observing their obligations in relation to personal data. In recent days, however, the Party has become aware of a number of attempts to access personal data held on the Party’s systems by iniduals who are not, or are no longer, authorised to do so.   We are aware that the Information Commissioner is taking an increasingly serious view of misuse of personal data. Anyone accessing, using or otherwise processing data without authority or for an unauthorised purpose is at risk of action by the Commissioner’s Office, whose powers have increased substantially since the  Act became law. The partys Organise site which hosts data collected on the electorates voting intention alongside Labour membership details was understood to have become unavailable on Wednesday afternoon. Left-wing activist Owen Jones said: Within two days of being founded, a nascent party which says politics is broken has potentially broken the law for political advantage   A Labour Party spokesman confirmed: We have become aware of attempts to access personal data held on the Party’s systems by iniduals who are not authorised to do so. Personal data the Party holds about iniduals is protected by law, under the GDPR and Data Protection Act . We are aware that the Information Commissioner is taking an increasingly serious view of misuse of personal data and requires a data controller to take reasonable and proportionate steps to ensure the security of data held on its systems. The Labour Party takes our data protection obligations extremely seriously. Questioned by the Mirror, former Labour MP Chris Leslie denied he was the MP accused of accessing data. He said: We did think through in our checklist of things that had to be done, obviouslyyoud resigned your Labour membership, you dont have access to Labour facilities and data and all those other things.And things have got to be destroyed up to that point. Obviously while youre still a Labour MP and youre still a member of the Labour Party you have access and use of all of that data as it was.This is a process of separation andthe focus of the party is going to be to kind of pick holes in the process of that separation, so be it.But were trying our best to do this in as decent a way as possible. He urged Labour HQ not to descend into character assassination.

title: shamima begum must come home
story: NewsopinionShamima Begum must come homeBritain is ever going to call itself great again good reasons why jihadi brides should- and  why youre being told they shouldntShareCommentsByFleet Street FoxColumnist:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsopinion"Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Around  British citizens travelled to Syria to join Islamic State. Research shows  of them have ed, without any hue and cry about the threat they represent.Most of them were male. Many were jihadi fighters. But its a lot more fun to talk of stripping a young woman, who has been just as stupid but not nearly as fighty as them.Shamima Begum was found in a Syrian refugee camp last week, having left her Bethnal Green home in  with stolen money and her passport. She had married a convicted Dutch terrorist, suffered two infant deaths, and was heavily pregnant with her third. Perhaps her biggest mistake was not to say she missed fish and chips. Had she begged for forgiveness, forsook all Islamic trappings and spoken plaintively about missing Coronation Street shed probably be on a plane home by now.Instead - silly girl - someone inculcated into a religious cult as a child, groomed to marry and have sex underage, who watched two babies die in a war zone, and was so desensitised to horror that she got used to seeing decapitated heads in bins, muttered the things shes been told for the past  years. While, it must be said, living alongside, and still reliant upon, her fellow indoctrinees.  Cue the pitchforks - shes no remorse, shes a threat to us all, keep her at arms . The media lap it up, everyone thanks the Lord that were not talking about Brexit for once, and Home Secretary Sajid Javid bows to public pressure to strip her of citizenship on the basis she can always go to Bangladesh.Only trouble is, shes never lived in Bangladesh. Wasnt born there, and previous citizenship appeals have ruled its illegal to force people to live there. Its not even clear shes ever applied to be a Bangladesh citizen, or that theyd accept her nowshe did. On top of all that, she gave birth days before Javid found his headline-grabbing loophole, so her son is a British citizen with a right to , and he can hardly get himself here from Syria without her.In fact there are  incredibly good and sane reasons why we should welcome Shamima - and all the other jihadis, jihadi brides and their children - home with open arms. The thoughtless mob, and the racists and ambitious politicians stoking it, wont like any of them. . Justice  When a British national commits a crime abroad, they serve their time in that country before being repatriated to the UK. In the case of notorious pop paedo Gary Glitter, he flitted between Spain, Cuba, Thailand, Vietnam and Cambodia, fleeing justice and being arrested, jailed and deported more than once. When he finally came home, he was sentenced to  years for sex offences.Shamima Begum cant face justice in Syria, because there is none. Its a largely-failed state run by a dictator and bombed to obliteration.She is our problem. She was born, raised and radicalised here. If she has committed an offence by being a member of a proscribed terrorist organisation, she has a right to a fair trial, due process, andconvicted some jail time.The only way Shamima - and the  other Brit women found in the camps - can EVER face justice isshe comes home.Besides,we ever want to deport a foreign criminal again we need to obey the rules we want to use. Otherwise theres nothing to stop other states - Bangladesh, say - telling us to keep the bomber to ourselves. . Intelligence Of the  who have ed, you can be sure that  of them have been questioned by the security services. They were pumped for information, passwords, names and places. Some will have been turned into double agents, others jailed, and some cut loose as losers who saw the error of their ways. They will all be under scrutiny of some sort.Those who dont come home dont talk. They dont feed information into the intelligence machine, and dont make bargains infor their freedom.If Shamima is not in the UKs jurisdiction, weve no right to question her. We dont co-operate with the Syrian regime, so cant sit in while they question her with pliers. The ONLY way to squeeze Shamima - to find out who and what she knows, to ensure we can capture others with the same madness - is to bring her back.. Redemption Perhaps most importantly of all, jihadis who have no home dont get deradicalised. They continue to float around the worlds worst places, dealing with the worlds worst people, hating the UK and all it stands for. Shamimas child - a Brit with the potential to be an upstanding, contributing citizen - will be radicalised too.Imagine , in a year or two, she is linked to an atrocity abroad, or her child is once hes grown. We could have saved those lives, but have chosen not to try.There are also any number of countries from which Shamima could board a flight to the UK. Once here, she could claim a right to remain as mother of a British son she could claim asylum, perhaps,subject to justice in a country like Syria or she could blow the plane to pieces. It does not make us safer to keep Shamima away it makes her a BIGGER danger. Its worth bearing in mind those  who have ed are living unnoticed - so by definition arent causing trouble.. Solutions Shamima was an academically-successful -year-old from a cosmopolitan city whose immediate family, according to their lawyer, were not particularly religious. Somehow she was sold the ISIS ideology - that the apocalypse was coming soon, and anyone not living in Syria in an Islamically-fundamentalist way would not get to heaven.How someone exposed to a globalised, inter-connected world, one where the entirety of human knowledge was available on a computer in our pockets, can come to believe such tripe is worthy of thought. If the tripe leads them to think blowing up children in Manchester Arena is justied, that a convicted terrorist is a perfect husband and heads in bins is merely a sign of good street hygiene, its worthy of serious investigation.When promises of apocalypse are proven , believers lose their faith. We need Shamima to come to her senses, then tell us what she saw and heard before she left. Who she spoke to, who advised her, how it worked. Then and only then can we stop it happening to others.If we keep her out, well never be less ignorant than we are. . Were not c***s

story: NewsVince Cable says Lib Dems wont stand against The Independent Group in electionsHe said it would be foolish to fight each other under the UKs electoral systemShareCommentsByBen GlazeDeputy political editorNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video vince-cable-offers-to-cooperate-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailVince Cable has said it would be foolish for the Lib Dems to compete with Independent Group MPs in elections. It came as a Shadow Minister told the Mirror most of the seven who resigned their membership would seek new seatsthey hoped to be re-elected to Parliament. And he warned that up to  more MPs could walkout over the next few weeks. The frontbencher told the Mirror they would look for Remain-supporting constituencies - and agree “non-aggression pacts” with Lib Dems so they did not split the pro-EU, centrist vote. Sir Vince has now publicly backed this idea agreeing that the new grouping, which was formed on Monday, shared many of the beliefs of his own party saying: we have to cooperate, there is a lot in common.   The party leader added that under the UKs electoral system the two groups could damage each other very badlythey stood against one another. Asked about Sir Vinces comments, MP Chris Leslie of the Independent Group said: Were not joining the Lib Dems. We believe there are problems with all the parties... They have got a clear trust issue. The Liberal Democrats and Green Party did not stand candidates against one another in a number of seats in the  General Election. The eight former Labour MPs and three former Tories are currently sitting together in the House of Commons in an informal grouping. But Streatham MP Chuka Umunna has said he hopes they will be a formal party by the end of the year. Sir Vince explained: The First Past the Post system means we would damage each other very badly so we have to have to cooperate, there is a lot in common in terms of values.  Referring to comments made by former Tory MP Anna Soubry, Sir Vince praised the way the Tories and Lib Dems worked together under the coalition describing it as a very good relationship. Labourinsiders believe voters could back a pro-EU candidate - but may be reluctant to supportLabourfor fear of propelling Mr Corbyn to No. Seats which could be targeted include Wimbledon in south-west London, held by pro-EU ToryministerStephen Hammond who has a majority of ,. Though he has signalled he could quit the frontbenchBritain heads for a hard Brexit , he could be punished by voters for helping push through EU withdrawal.   Other seats could include Chipping Barnet in north London, held by arch Brexiteer Tory former CabinetMinisterTheresa Villiers with a tiny  majority, and Iain Duncan Smith’s Chingford and Wood Green constituency, where the former Welfare Secretary has a , majority. Tory Matthew Offord in Hendon, north London, could be vulnerable with a majority of just ,. And defectors could also target Leave-supportingLabourMP Kate Hoey in Vauxhall, south London. She enjoys a massive , majority but is a leading Brexiteer in a constituency which voted .% for Remain.

title: alesha macphail dads girlfriend said
story: NewsAlesha MacPhail: Dads girlfriend said girl, , was in "better place" after deathAleshas body was found in woodland on the Isle of Bute, Scotland, last July - a -year-old boy denies her abduction, rape and murderShareBySophie EvansLaura Paterson:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsAlesha MacPhail was found dead in woodland in July last year "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe girlfriend of Alesha MacPhails dad suggested the six-year-old was in a better place after she was found dead, a court has heard.Toni McLachlan saw her good friend Lynsey Calderwood the day after Aleshas body was discovered in woodland on Scotlands Isle of Bute.She told her pal something along the lines of shes in a better place in reference to the little girls death, Glasgows High Court was told.Giving evidence at the court this morning, Ms Calderwood, , said she thought Ms McLachlans comment on July  last year was odd.Her police statement had Ms McLachlan - the girlfriend of Aleshas dad, Robert MacPhail - saying something like Its for the best.But Ms Calderwood said she had definitely said shes in a better place.  A -year-old boy, who cannot be named for legal reasons, is on trial accused of abducting, raping and murdering Alesha - which he denies. The prosecution today withdrew one charge against the teenager - attempting to defeat the ends of justice, by disposing of clothing. Aleshas body was found on the island on July , , just hours after she was reported missing from the home her dad shared with her grandparents.The accused has lodged a special defence of incrimination, claiming that Ms McLachlan committed the crime. However, the court has heard Ms McLachlan was said to love Alesha and be really good to her.  During her evidence today, Ms Calderwood told jurors she was good friends with Ms McLachlan when Alesha went missing. Questioned about Ms McLachlans relationship with the schoolgirl, the witness said: They were happy, they got on really well.Toni was really good to her and they both liked each other. In a statement given to police on July , Ms Calderwood said: I always felt Toni was jealous and she felt threatened of the time and attention Rabgave to Alesha. The witness told the court Ms McLachlan was a wee bit jealous but not really jealous of the youngster. The trial continues.

title: britains fattest dog finally gets
story: NewsBritains fattest dog finally gets new home after shedding THREE STONEPortly pooch Hattie the Fattie was a diabetic and almost blind when she arrived at Devon animal shelter last year - but she has shed the pounds after ditching hamburgersShareCommentsByAdam Aspinall:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsHattie before she shed almost three stone "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Britains fattest dog  who grew to the size of a pot-bellied pig after living on hamburgers has finally found a home - after shedding nearly half her body weight.Hattie the Fattie was taken into care weighing st, but despite her large frame she soon won over carers at the animal sanctuary. They put the overweight pooch on a special diet and her weight plummeted to st lbs. Offers to re-home the plump pooch came flocking in but her rescuer has now decided to adopt her and become her permanent owner. Ruth Rickard, , deputy manager at Gables Farm shelter in Plymouth, Devon, said she couldnt give her up as she had taken a special liking to her.  I couldnt imagine her living with anyone . I did get very attached to her and all her little funny ways, she admitted. Hattie was morbidly obese, diabetic and almost blind when she arrived at the dogs and cats home in April last year. Speaking at the time, Ruth said: When I first saw Hattie I couldn’t believe it as she looked more like a pot-bellied pig than a dog. I just knew we had to try and help her. I take her home with me at night so I can administer her insulin injections, which she tolerates very well. As the weight has started to come off we have found that she is very spirited and extremely loving, despite the fact we put her on a diet.   She spends her days in our reception, keeping an eye on the staff and customers, and as we watch her gain confidence and lose weight it makes me proud that we are a genuine non euthanasia charity. A healthy female collie should weigh between  and kg, but Hattie is currently kg - the same weight as a small dear or two full bags of concrete. Hattie is on a strictly controlled diet to lose the weight slowly and safely and, to date, she’s managed to shed kg. Ruth added: “We have seen some wrecked animals that we have found homes for after proper care, nutrition and TLC. “I try to be positive. I’m aiming to get her down to about  kilos. “We are trying to get her to go out four or five times a day.   She was over kg, we’ve got the previous vet history - I don’t think the owner was very well. “She’s only six years old. For a collie, she should be looking at a -year le expectancy. “She’s quite a character, she so deserves the public to get behind her. “Since she started losing weight, she’s changed - it was like she had no real enjoyment of le before and was just existing. Ruth said she recalled mistaking the plump pup for a pot-bellied pig when she walked through the door. The eight-year-old collie-cross, who was rescued by the RSPCA over welfare concerns, was put on a strict regime of diet and exercise to help her lose weight safely. The charity also set up a fundraiser to help cover her vet bills, including twice-daily insulin shots and cataracts surgery to restore her vision.

title: britains talent star living rose
story: NewsBritains Got Talent star living in Rose Wests house finds toys buried in gardenEscape artist Merlin Cadogan, , who performed on the talent show in  stays in the home where the notorious killer grew upShareByLaura Forsyth:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsRose West was imprisoned for le on ten counts of murder "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA Britains Got Talent star discovered he is living in Rose Wests childhood home - and has found toys buried in the garden. Semi-finalist Merlin Cadogan, , stays in the Devon home where Britains most notorious female killer grew up. Rose went on to murder victims with husband Fred - several of whom they buried under their patio in Cromwell Street. Escape artist Merlin now lives in the property where she was raised in Northam and says he recently became nervous when digging up the garden to install a decking. But he says when he did he found a plastic toy deep in the soil. Merlin said: When we moved in I looked up in the attic. There was something up there nailed to one of the wooden cross beam joists. It looked like a shield or symbol from some sort of army regiment. It had a crest with thistles on it. I was too freaked out to touch it, but I did do a bit of research into it.   Apparently many people used to do this so that loved ones could always find their way home. Its still up there now, but I dont knowits got anything to do with Rose Wests family. I must admit, when I was digging up the garden I was a bit nervous. Id like to say I found something interesting that could have been hers, but all I found was a little toy plastic horse, which probably had nothing to do with her.  West, who together with her husband Fred are believed to be responsible for at least  murders, grew up in the house in Morwenna Park Road. It was here when her father, Bill Letts, a paranoid schizophrenic, beat and tortured his family. He began sexually grooming Rose and by the age of , she was sexually abusing her two younger brothers too.   The former home on is now owned by Merlin, an escapologist and juggler who made the semi-finals of Britains Got Talent back in . Merlin has done a fair bit of work to the s semi-detached pad he now shares with his girlfriend Catherine, her two children Riley and Casey, and his daughter Lu. Among the work was decking the rear garden and levelling out the front garden for gravel. And he said his heart did skip a beat as he delved into what was underneath. Rose, now , is said to have became a sex abuser at , a murderer at  and a fully fledged serial killer while still in her teens. Merlin, , who also holds the world record for the longest time juggling three objects underwater on a single breath, has lived at the former council house since .   He says he knew about Roses connection with the house before he bought it. It never bothered me, he added. I heard she had lived there when she was young, but she was only a child then, just a little kid. We bought it from a lovely family  years ago and it has probably changed hands several times since she lived here. It certainly didnt put me off buying the house. Merlin says he doesnt think any of the children know about who used to live at the house. But he added: Its just a house.  Rose was born in Northam in November . After a troubled childhood at the age of  she fell in love with  year old Fred West. The couple moved together to Gloucester at the beginning of the s and began more than a decade of sexual abuse and murder. Fred West killed himself in HMP Birmingham while on remand accused of murdering  girls and women in  before he could stand trial. We Rose, remains locked up at Low Newton prison in County Durham after being convicted of murdering  victims. From  to , nine victims were buried at the House of Horrors on Cromwell Street, Gloucester. To this day, West still denies her role in the murders.

title: butlins staff did nothing boy
story: NewsButlins staff did nothing as boy, , choked to death at holiday parkJames Manning, two, from Battle in East Sussex, died in June while staying with his family at Butlins in Bognor RegisShareCommentsByAdela WhittinghamMichael Drummond:,  FEB NewsButlins in Bognor Regis "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Butlins staff have been accused of standing around doing nothing as a two-year-old boy choked to death at a holiday park, an inquest has heard.Tragic two-year-old James Manning was staying at Butlins in Bognor Regis, West Sussex, with his family last June. But when he started to choke at a restaurant on the site paramedics found they couldnt get to the youngster because the path was blocked by gates and bollards, the hearing was told. The toddler, from Battle, East Sussex, had previously needed medical attention in the past because he had trouble with choking, the inquest heard. James was taken to hospital but died on June . His local GP, the South East Coast Ambulance service, East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust and Butlins were all represented at a pre-inquest review hearing.   James mum Natalie was also present as were other members of his family. Assistant Coroner Karen Harrold said: Having listened to the  call, I am concerned about the handling of that telephone call and whether the paramedics had specic instructions as to how to get in. Given James was two and choking it seems to me that every second counted. I am concerned about the delay in getting cars through the gates. She also told the hearing she was concerned that once on site the paramedics were impeded by gates and retractable bollards that were locked into place. One paramedic made the decision to run to James because the ambulance could not get through the bollards, the inquest heard.   Ms Harrold said: There should have been a clear path through. There should not have been any delay at all. When paramedics arrived they reported seeing that safety staff were standing around doing nothing, she told the inquest. Mum Natalie said: I tried my best and literally every member of the public was trying to help. There were not any First Aiders on site who helped us. The inquest will also look at what happened in the three or four month period between a doctor referring James for an operation and his death. Mum Natalie said: It was me having to get onto doctors and bang on the doors. The inquest was adjourned until a full hearing on a date to be set.

title: gareth southgates tribute footballer 17
story: NewsGareth Southgates tribute to footballer, , killed in Thailand motorbike crashEngland boss Southgate said the death of teen Anthony Ryan was a "reminder to us all to make the most of every day"ShareCommentsByBarnaby Kellaway:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsAnthony Ryan died in a motorcycle crash "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email England football manager Gareth Southgate has paid tribute in an emotional letter read out at the funeral of a teen who died in Thailand.Anthony Ryan, , died in a horror smash on the island of Phuket last month when the motorcycle he was riding collided head-on with a van. Southgate said Anthonys death was incredibly sad and described it as a reminder to us all to make the most of everyday. The former footballer met Anthony when he coached a training session at the boys school in Bradford, West Yorkshire, in .   A picture shows the youngster, who was  or  at the time, alongside Southgate, who was then the England under- manager. His letter was read out during the service by Lyndsey Brown, headteacher at Oastlers School in Bradford, where Anthony was a student. It said: I just wanted to write to you all having heard the incredibly sad news about Anthony. Sean Reagansent me a picture of the day I came up to visit and Anthony was involved in that training session. I know this will have been a dficult time for you all and it will be really hard to move forward.   I am sure you will all pay your respects in the appropriate way and you will all be there to support Anthonys family. What has happened is a reminder to us all to make the most of every day. During the service Anthony was described as a beautul, incredibly intelligent and amazing boy by his family, friends and former teachers. Headteacher Mrs Brown remembered Anthony as a talented athlete who excelled at football and boxing. She recounted a story where her former pupil, who had a wicked sense of humour, made a teacher a cup of coffee with a teaspoon of salt instead of sugar. Hundreds of mourners wearing red lined the road leading up to St Christophers Church in Bradford before the service was held.   Anthony, the oldest of five brothers, died in Thailand on January  while away on holiday with a friend. He was overtaking on a motorcycle when he collided with an oncoming vehicle head on. Anthony died at the scene of the crash. In the days after the incident his friends and family used a crowdfunding website to raise pound, to pay for his body to be flown home. He had only recently moved from Bradford to Penzance in Cornwall, where he had a job setting up events.

story: NewsGhost stalks drinker at one of Britain’s most haunted pubs’ in bone chilling videoLandlady Ellie Boiling said guests have run out in terror at the The Dolphin in Littlehampton, West SussexShareCommentsByKelly-Ann Mills:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video ghost-stalks-drinker-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA drinker at ‘one of Britains most haunted pubs’ claims to have been stalked by a ghost in this bone-chilling CCTV footage. Landlady Ellie Boiling says The Dolphin in Littlehampton, West Sussex, is plagued with ghosts and she has even had guests run out in terror. The footage shows a punter enjoying a drink in the pub when a spectral white figure appears behind him, approaches and then vanishes. “He was the most sceptic man I’ve ever met in my le,” said Ellie, . “He was lucid, he wasn’t drunk or anything. “He phoned me and said: ‘I’ve just seen something go past me, can you look on your CCTV to see what it was ’ “I rewound it and I was like ‘Oh my God’.   “I was shocked, I wasn’t expecting to see anything – I thought maybe it was a dog or something – but there it was. “He was a sceptic and he was shaken. All his beliefs seemed to have gone out the window.” The landlady and self-styled ghost hunter says the spooks at the pub include a former cook who was murdered by her abusive uncle, as well as the malevolent spirit of the uncle himself. She claims there’s also the spectre of a man in RAF fatigues, the ghost of a woman in white, and a mischievous spook who throws p coins at customers. Some guests have even fled in the middle of the night, Ellie said. “There was a man and woman who once stayed in room two – they paid cash for the whole week,” she said. “On the first night he came down in a little towel and he said ‘you’ve got to move me!’ He said ‘somebody has just floated through my door and out through the window’. They were absolutely hysterical. “I moved them up to room six and I knocked on the door in the morning to give them breakfast, and they’d gone.   “So I checked my CCTV and they left at half past four in the morning… they didn’t want their money back, they’ve never been in touch, and I never heard from them again.” Ellie says the haunting at The Dolphin is so severe that one room has even been shut off to guests. She believes that room is haunted by a ghost child whose portrait is preserved on a photographic plate discovered in the pub. “I named this girl Little Dolly because everybody calls my pub The Dolly,” she said. But Ellie was more than a bit spooked when a mysterious stranger entered the pub one day and revealed that the nickname was far older than she’d realised. “He said ‘my grandad used to own this pub  years ago and he had  children. One unfortunately died of diphtheria, up in the old nursery I believe, and her name was Little Dolly.’  “And he took me to the grave just up the road and there it was. Her name was Ada Constance Parish and inscribed above it, it said ‘Little Dolly’. “I didn’t know that was her name. I just called her that because of the pub’s nickname.” For Ellie, the pubs reputation as a haunt for ghosts is well deserved. “I’ve been a ghost hunter for  years and I’ve been around. “I do many charity ghost hunts and go round people’s houses to help them – but this is by far the most active haunting I’ve ever experienced.” The pub itself dates back to  and has welcomed guests including Lord Byron, Oliver Reed and Benny Hill.

story: NewsJust  minutes of exercise a day as good as drugs to lower blood pressureA short burst of fitness in the morning reduced levels for the rest of the day, a study foundShareCommentsByStephen White:,  FEB NewsThe exercise could be walking on a treadmill at moderate intensity "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Just  minutes of exercise a day may be as effective as drugs at lowering blood pressure , a study has found.Walking on a treadmill in the morning reduced participants’ levels for the rest of the day. Overweight and obese men and women aged - took part in three plans, with ied amounts of sitting and walking. The plan that lowered blood pressure the most involved an hour of sitting then  minutes of treadmill walking. It was followed by . hours of sitting, interrupted every half hour with three minutes of walking.  The  participants ate the same meals during the laboratory study. Blood pressure was lower in the people whose exercised compared to those who did not. Women in particular saw extra benefits from three-minute walks, but researchers are not sure why. Lead author Michael Wheeler, of University of Western Australia, Perth, said: “The magnitude of reduction in blood pressure following exercise and breaks in sitting approached what might be expected from anti-hypertensive medication.” Chris Allen, of the British Heart Foundation, said: “This study supports a huge body of evidence that shows regular physical activity can help towards lowering your blood pressure and reduce your risk of heart attacks and strokes.”

The -year-old took to social media following the death of -year-old Seven Bridges, from America, who was driven to suicide after he was tormented by bullies over his colostomy bag.Ben posted: So I’ve seen all over my news feed all day about Seven Bridges, a  year old that killed himself because he was being bullied about his stoma bag.I just wanted to do a #bagsoutforseven post to anyone with kids on my fb please make them aware of how amazing these le saving bags are! Anda big YouTube star like me has one they must be cool right. At the time of having my large bowel removed, I didnt want to have a stoma bag, as I thought that it would completely ruin my le, said Ben. In the end though, that kind of thinking was silly, as the bag in fact saved my le and really improved it. Now I dont have to worry about any flare ups or stress about where the nearest loos are, which I had to do before I got my bag. My stoma is permanent as my rectum has been taken permanently away through surgery, and since then Ive had a fistula - a hole in my body - that took time to heal.   Ive also had more surgery in November  to try and fix a cavity that developed, but it was unsuccessful. I went in again for an operation last month, but again it didnt work, so Im now trying medication to try and fix the problem. Ben says he shares his social media updates to help others in the same position as him and to lend a hand of support. He said: Having my stoma bag has enabled me to live a normal le - I work in retail, but Im off at the moment whilst I recover from surgery but I dont let it get me down and Im slowly getting better. I know that some people who also have stoma bags like me can get upset about it but I just want to inspire others that our bags are there for a reason, and that we should wear them with pride. The reaction to Bens videos have been overwhelmingly positive and he says he is all too happy to have made a positive impact.Ive had a great reaction with all my posts on Facebook , and I was real surprised with the , shares that I got after posting a picture of me with my bag after Seven Bridges sadly committed suicide after being bullied about his bag.Im happy to have been able to educate people and raise awareness of Crohns disease and colitis and hopefully to make a dference. story: NewsPensioner nudged car into pram carrying baby to push it off pedestrian crossingJoyce Jenkins, , is accused of using her car in a "ridiculously dangerous" bid to get the pram off the crossingShareByNeil Murphy:,  FEB NewsJoyce Jenkinss actions were described in court as ridiculously dangerous "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA driver nudged her car into a pram carrying a nine-month-old baby to push it off a pedestrian crossing, a court heard. Joyce Jenkins, , is accused of using her car in a ridiculously dangerous bid to get the pram off the crossing when the lights turned green. Mum Keranne Jones, , told how she was pushing baby daughter Amelia across the road when the lights changed as Jenkins waited in her blue Ford Fiesta. Miss Jones said: The blue car started edging forward. I stopped the pram just in case the driver didnt see me. But Miss Jones said she then carried on crossing towards the central reservation after believing Jenkins had stopped. She told how the Fiesta began to edge forward with the driver pointing towards the lights and saying something.  Swansea Crown Court both women shouted at each other on the busy pedestrian crossing on the dual carriageway at Carmarthen Road in Swansea. story: NewsShamima Begum: Twelve Brit women have arrived in Syrian camps in past WEEKISIS bride Begum, , is living in a refugee camp in northern Syria after travelling to the war-torn nation from her east London homeShareCommentsBySophie Evans:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video many--british-women-arrived-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news uk-news  , theme : # , title : Mirror UK News ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTwelve British women have arrived at camps in northern Syria - where ISIS bride Shamima Begum is living - in the past week alone.Begum, who fled the UK to join ISIS aged , was recently found pregnant and living in a refugee camp in the war-torn country.Now a -year-old mother to four-day-old baby Jarrah, she has been stripped of her British citizenship by the Home Secretary. But she will not be the last Islamic State bride or supporter to prove a headache for the UK Government, experts have warned. Over just seven days, a DOZEN other UK women have descended on displacement camps in the area, BBC News reports. The circumstances surrounding why these women travelled to Syria and how they have ended up at the camps is unclear.  Speaking from the Middle East last night, BBC correspondent Quentin Sommerville said: This whole issue of what to do with these IS women and other IS supporters isnt going to go away.We know that in the last week alone,  British women have arrived at displacement camps here in northern Syria. So for the British Government, this headache of what to do doesnt end with Shamima Begum. Begum, from Bethnal Green, east London, is not the first ISIS supporter to have been stripped of their British citizenship. It emerged this week that Home Secretary Sajid Javid had ordered the move against her as the so-called caliphate crumbles. The teenager was among a trio of girls from Bethnal Green Academy who travelled to Syria to support the terror group in February .   She now wants toto the UK with newborn Jarrah - her third child, after she reportedly lost two other children as infants. Her familys lawyer, Tasnime Akunjee, has said her relatives are very disappointed over the move to strip her of her citizenship. They are considering all legal avenues to challenge this decision. International law forbids nations from making people stateless by revoking their only citizenship, while Government guidance from  states that the Home Secretary has the power to order the deprivationit would be conducive to the public good, and as long as they are not left without any citizenship. However, Begums lawyer told the Press Association that the teenager - who is of Bangladeshi heritage - was born in the UK, has never had a Bangladeshi passport and is not a dual citizen.   The Home Office said such decisions are not taken lightly and are carried out in order to protect this country. We do not comment on inidual cases, but any decisions to deprive iniduals of their citizenship are based on all available evidence and not taken lightly, a spokesperson said. ITV News reported a letter from the department was received by Begums mother on Tuesday. Please find enclosed papers that relate to a decision taken by the Home Secretary, to deprive your daughter, Shamima Begum, of her British citizenship, the letter read. In light of the circumstances of your daughter, the notice of the Home Secretarys decision has been served of file today , and the order removing her British citizenship has subsequently been made.   The document asked the teenagers mum to inform her daughter of the decision, as well as her right to appeal. Begum, who gave birth to Jarrah on Saturday, has made pleas for forgiveness and to be accepted back in the UK. This week, she compared the Manchester Arena bombing to military strikes on ISIS strongholds, calling the terror attack retaliation. politan Police Commissioner Cressida Dick has signalled she could be arrested and investigatedshe s to Britain. There are currently plans to change the law to make travelling to certain terror hotspots a criminal offence, but this would not apply retrospectively to Begum. story: NewsWoman told she looks like something out of Monsters Inc. says trolls are just jealousA woman who has been bullied online for getting lip fillers is speaking out in an attempt to end the crueltyShareCommentsByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsShauna has been targeted by cruel online trolls "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAt the age of , Shauna Sargeant took the plunge and paid for ml of filler to be injected into her lips. The young woman had spent years feeling insecure about the size of her lips and was finally ready to do something about it. So she splashed out pound for the injection and has since had four more injections, spending a total of pound, so far.The make-up artist is thrilled with the results of the filler , but not everyone has been kind about her new appearance. The now -year-old has been subjected to bullying, as trolls online call her a train wreck for having a trout pout. Shauna revealed how this has impacted her confidence to .She said: My appearance is very important to me so seeing someone ridicule it, its taken very personally. When I see those posts, I start shaking and my anxiety goes through the roof.   People that go and get their lips done have obviously had insecurities about that so to pick up on that and make fun of it is a really low blow. For Shauna, the cruel comments are a daily occurance.Its a daily thing, I see it all the time, she admits. Im in a make-up group where I post my pictures and everyone is so supportive but my photos are being stolen.Its happening to me and so many girls, were being slated.   She describes the bullying as disgusting and says its totally uncalled for.As well as being branded fish lips, one person even went as far as to compare her to something out of the Pixar film, Monsters Inc.She explained: One person said my lips look like Ive had the screams sucked out of me like in Monsters Inc. Thats nothing to do with my make-up, its actually just mocking my face.   Shauna believes the reason people are so cruel to her comes down to jealousy. She suggests people might be bitter that they lack the confidence to go out and try new looks like she does. But despite everything, she refuses to let the haters stop her from enjoying her new lips and hopes that by sharing her experiences shell inspire people to stop trolling others online. She added: Im so sick of seeing people tear each other down. At the end of the day, you are your own biggest critic and youve probably said worse to yourself than anything anyone  can ever say to you. The only one living your le is you and the only one who can make you happy is you, so I wont let them get in between me and my love of make-up or my lips.

title: zoo slammed letting children play
story: NewsZoo slammed for letting children play tug of war with LIONS for £ a timeDartmoor Zoo has offered the human vs beast challenge since earlier this month and claim it is good for the lions and tigersShareCommentsByTom DavidsonOnline Reporter:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsA still from a video which had been filmed of Jasiri the lion during the experience"Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA zoo has been blasted for allowing children to play tug of war with lions and tigers as part of a human v beast challenge. Children as young as eight can take part in the challenge, which launched at Dartmoor Zoo earlier this month. The game sees four people pitted against one of its big cats in an activity zoo keepers have said the animals find enriching. The experience costs pound per person and is set to help create the best welfare possible for the animals.In an advertisement for the experience on the zoos Facebook page, it says that this type of enrichment is very important to keep the cats fit and healthy. Animal rights groups have hit out at the zoo and have said the experience has no respect for the animals, while others branded the organisers as morons. In a tweet to Datmoor Zoo, The Born Free Foundation said: @.DartmoorZoo to offer ‘Human vs Beast Experience’ this February half-term. Is a tug of war game with a lion or tiger really the way to inspire respect for these animals  RT to urge the zoo to rethink this! #DontBuyCaptivity #KeepWildleinTheWild. Other activists said: Is this for real  What moron thought that this was a good idea. Competitors can take on either the zoos male tiger Dragan or its male lion Jasirir.   Meat is attached to a rope to bait the animals and when it picks it up the participants, which are on the other side of the fence, take up the other end of rope for a tug-of-war.Speaking to the Daily Star, senior zoo keeper Simon Moore said this sort of experience is essential for the animals.He said: In captivity, its essential for us to try to mimic the behaviours to create the best welfare possible. We do a lot of enrichment for the cats and this is just one type.   The zoos CEO Benjamin Mee said the activity is common across other zoos and wildle parks and that the lions like it. The public like it and its working well. It is regarded as really good enrichment for the animals, whether the public are involved or not. Social media users also aired their frustration at the activity with one user saying that the zoo was shameful.  Jo Hollis said: Dartmoor zoo should be ashamed of themselves. Please explain how this is conservation allowing people near WILD ANIMALS. Its not! Its a money grabbing scheme at the animals expense.Twitter user @paulwrites said: Are they living in medieval times  Whoever thought of this and backed it should think very carefully about demonising animals as commodities for profit.

story: NewsArticial beaches, wall-to-wall aquariums and T-Rex skeletons - inside the worlds most extravagant superyachtsPlans for a new superyacht, known as Project Valkyrie, is set to blow all the worlds other most luxurious vessels out of the waterShareByMatt Roper:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB News "Get the biggest Royal Family stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailEven by the standards of Saudi Sheiks and Russian oligarchs, the next superyacht to hit the waters is pretty breathtaking. Like the other of the worlds ultra-luxury yachts, it looks set to become the plaything of one of the worlds richest people. Here we look at some of the others which, while they will soon be falling into the shadow of the Valkyrie, nevertheless offer more luxury that most of us could ever dream of. Project Valkyrie  Although still in its planning stage, should it come to le Valkyrie will be by far the most extravagant private vessel ever to take to the seas. The yacht is the brainchild of design companies Chulhun Design and Palmer Johnson, who have worked on super yachts although never one this grand. The yacht will measure ftin , which is more than two-thirds theof the worlds longest cruise ship, Royal Carribbeans Symphony of the Seas.  Itll also have room on board for over  people, including  guests and about  staff. The yacht, while only designed to sleep up to  people, also features a number of public spaces including a casino, theatre, mall, restaurants, and exhibition halls. And it comes with the same, exclusive price tag - an estimated pound,. History Supreme This ftsuperyacht, which took world-renowned UK designer Stuart Hughes three years to complete, became the world’s most expensive yacht when it was purchased by an anonymous Malaysian businessman for pound.billion in . The staggering sum is owed to the solid gold and platinum used to assembly this luxury liner which features no less than , kg of the precious metals. They adorn the entirety of the boat right from the base of the vessel, coated in a thin layer of solid gold, to the dining area, deck, rails, staircases and anchor. If that wasn’t extravagant enough, a wall feature in the master bedroom boasts a feature made form meteorite rock, and a statue made from genuine Tyrannosaurus Rex bones. Also on board is a luxury liquor bottle featuring an . carat diamond, one of the world’s rarest, along with a panoramic wall aquarium made from kg of  carat gold. If that’s not enough some of other on-board features include an iPhone wrapped in  cut diamonds including two interchangeable diamonds fitted over the “home button”, a . carat pink diamond and a rare eight carat diamond. Eclipse  The second most expensive yacht in the world belongs to Russian oligarch and Cha owner Roman Abramovich, who is rumoured to have paid around poundmillion for it in . Built by Blohm and Voss of Hamburg, the Eclipse is also the second largest at ftlong, and needs a -member crew to run. The Eclipse’s immense size allows space for the boat’s many extravagant features, including  guest cabins, two swimming pools, several hot tubs, and a disco hall, as well as two helicopter pads, three launch boats and a mini-submarine.  And for maximum security, the superyacht has its own missile defence system, while the master bedroom and bridge of the yacht features fitted armour plating and bulletproof windows. Finally, the unique vessel boats an “anti-paparazzi” shield which uses lasers to sweep the surrounding areas. Upon detection of possible lurking professional photographers, a light is shone directly upon the camera to prevent a photograph being taken. Azzam  At ftthe Azzam is ftlonger than Abramovich’s yacht and took the world’s largest yacht title from the Russian when it was launched in . Ownership of the poundmillion craft is shrouded in secrecy but it is rumoured to have been paid for by a member of the Saudi royal family, Alwaleed Bin Talal Alsaud. As well as being the longest - more than  double decker buses - it is also one of the fastest. The , horsepower vessel can reach speeds of more than  knots, or mph.  Its designers, Nauta Yachts, boasted that Azzam, which means dedication in Arabic, is the most complex and challenging yacht that has ever been built. Although little is known about the interior of the yacht, it requires a staff of . Topaz  British designer Tim Heywod spent four years creating this huge boat, which cost around poundmillion. At ftlong it was the fourth longest yacht ever built when it was finished in  and boasts a weight thought to be in excess of , tonnes. The yacht features a steel displacement hull and an aluminum megastructure with  decks for dferent exotic viewing experiences, with a large jacuzzi and swimming deck with a built-in swimming pool. The Topaz also comes with fancy underwater lights, double helicopter landing pads, a state-of-the-art gymnasium, cinema hall and a large conference room.  The identity of the billionaire customer is unknown with Lurssen, the boats manufacturer, unwilling to discuss personal clients due to strict confidentiality agreements, but it is rumoured to be Shaikh Mansour, the Deputy Prime Minister of United Arab Emirates and a member of the royal family of Abu Dhabi. Dubai  Originally a joint project between Blohm + Voss and Luumlrssen shipyards, the Dubai was commissioned by Prince Jefri Bolkiah of Brunei more than  years prior to the ship’s launch in . In  it was acquired by by Platinum Yachts for Sheik Mohammed Rashid al-Maktoum, the ruler of Dubai, who set about personally designing its decadent interior, regarded as the most extravagant art-deco of any yacht. Using many of the world’s finest fabrics and intricately detailed handmade mosaics, it features a stunning circular staircase with glass steps designed to change colour with the help of natural light radiating inward from the top deck.  With the ability to accommodate as many as  passengers and crew, the seven decks of the Dubai have each been meticulously designed to meet the owner’s needs, with many VIP suites, sunbathing areas, several jacuzzis, a swimming pool, complete with elaborate handmade tiling and an expansive lounge for socialising with guests. A helipad which can accommodate a helicopter of up to . tonnes completes this extravagant ensemble, priced at poundm and previously the largest yacht in the world. Serene  Presently owned by the billionaire Mohammed bin Salman, the crown prince of Saudi Arabia accused of ordering the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi inside the Saudi embassy in Turkey, this Italian-made superyacht was customer built for the Russian vodka tycoon Yuri Shefler. Microsoft founder Bill Gates would rent the superyacht for million a week, until Salman saw it while holidaying in France and at once board it for around poundm.
